headline: Gov. DeWine renames state parks in honor of Bengals ahead of Super Bowl
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences:
pic.twitter.com/gdY9XJMYev
— Governor Mike DeWine (@GovMikeDeWine) February 7, 2022
First-year kicker Evan McPherson is getting some love from the Governor's Office as well, with Bainbridge's Paint Creek State Park being given the moniker of "Evan McPherson Extra Point Creek State Park."

@McPherson_Evan, whose game-winning kicks in the divisional playoff and AFC Conference Championship games helped send the @Bengals to the #SuperBowl, will be celebrated at Paint Creek State Park in Bainbridge with the moniker of "Evan McPherson Extra Point Creek State Park."

pic.twitter.com/kXsEeVp7HN
— Governor Mike DeWine (@GovMikeDeWine) February 7, 2022
Hueston Woods State Park is being renamed in honor of Bengals legend Ickey Woods, with the College Corner location now being dubbed "Ickey Woods State Park."

Mike DeWine has announced the Ohio Department of Natural Resources is celebrating the Cincinnati Bengals' run to the Super Bowl by renaming three state parks around the state in honor of players past and present.
Ahead of #SuperBowl LVI on Sunday, Burr Oak State Park in Glouster will be referred to as “Burrow Oak State Park" in honor of Bengals quarterback @JoeyB, who grew up in nearby Athens, Ohio.

pic.twitter.com/jKzELTXzx3
— Governor Mike DeWine (@GovMikeDeWine) February 7, 2022
According to the governor, the parks will go by their Bengals names throughout Super Bowl week.
First, Burr Oak State Park in Glouster is being re-named "Burrow State Park," in honor of Bengals star quarterback Joe Burrow, who is from Athens.

You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site.
The park, now dubbed "Ickey Woods State Park," is located between Cincinnati and Dayton near @miamiuniversity.
Hueston Woods State Park in College Corner will honor legendary @Bengals running back Ickey Woods.
The Bengals will face the Los Angeles Rams in the Super Bowl on Sunday, Feb. 13.
